intro: Trisetopsis barbata, commonly known as the hairy trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Trisetopsis barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
